update.description:
Inspired by the work started [here](https://bitbucket.org/JChoclin/ign-gazebo/branch/ign_sensors_integration#chg-src/SimulationRunner.cc) by @JChoclin.

Needs [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/488/port-pull-request-481-to-gz11/diff).

I'm not convinced of the current architecture yet, as I'm not sure exactly how Ignition Sensors is meant to be used. We may want to split it into multiple systems... one per sensor, one per group of sensors? 

---

## Try it out!

Run the example world:

    ign-gazebo -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/camera_sensor.sdf

Echo images to see they're indeed  being published:

    ign topic -e -t /camera

---

## TODO

* Decide on the architecture
* ~~Populate scene from components~~
* Add ign-sensors as a dependency on CI
* Add tests
* ~~Port ign-gui's image viewer to QtQuick so we can see the camera images~~
* Try multiple cameras
* ... anything else?
update.title: [WIP] Camera sensors

content.raw:
Started laying the groundwork to add sensors to CI:

* ~~Pipelines in this PR~~
* ~~[release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/708/add-fuel-tools-and-sensors-to-ign-gazebo/diff)~~
* [homebrew-simulation PR](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/564) - pending zmq fix
* ~~It's already there on [gazebodistro](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebodistro/src/41cecb2aff559c9f112223b91df087efedcd5da8/ign-default.yaml?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ign-default.yaml-34)~~

~~We will likely need a new ign-sensors release before this all can be merged.~~ It's being nightli-ed
content.html:
Started laying the groundwork to add sensors to CI:

  • Pipelines in this PR
  • release-tools PR
  • homebrew-simulation PR - pending zmq fix
  • It's already there on gazebodistro

We will likely need a new ign-sensors release before this all can be merged. It's being nightli-ed

content.raw: I just realized my current design doc PR [mentions sensors](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/98/design-doc-beginning-of-plugin-interface/diff#Ldoc/architecture_design.mdT461) and forgets about ign-sensors, feel free to work on top of that, add a section to that file or start a new file just for sensors.
content.html: I just realized my current design doc PR mentions sensors and forgets about ign-sensors, feel free to work on top of that, add a section to that file or start a new file just for sensors.

content.raw:
Thanks for the feedback. I think the major concerns have been captured. My statement "Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models", would be similar to distributing raw SDF description files but not the DOM/parser. Again taking camera as an example, a user of ign-sensor could instantiate a Camera and use it to generate images. All lifecycle management would be left up to the user.

Moving management of sensors outside of ign-sensors could be beneficial also because:

1. Instantiation of a sensor could require passing in a rendering engine or physics engine, or callbacks to get information fromm an engine.
2. Logging data could be more efficient. Instead of relying on transport, we could directly access sensor data and dump it to a database along with other state information.
3. Gazebo would have complete control over the sensor update cycle.

I'll work on a design document for this, or update an existing document if one has already been started.
content.html:
Thanks for the feedback. I think the major concerns have been captured. My statement "Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models", would be similar to distributing raw SDF description files but not the DOM/parser. Again taking camera as an example, a user of ign-sensor could instantiate a Camera and use it to generate images. All lifecycle management would be left up to the user.

Moving management of sensors outside of ign-sensors could be beneficial also because:

  1. Instantiation of a sensor could require passing in a rendering engine or physics engine, or callbacks to get information fromm an engine.
  2. Logging data could be more efficient. Instead of relying on transport, we could directly access sensor data and dump it to a database along with other state information.
  3. Gazebo would have complete control over the sensor update cycle.

I'll work on a design document for this, or update an existing document if one has already been started.

content.raw: +1 to the points about physics and making sensor data available to other systems
content.html: +1 to the points about physics and making sensor data available to other systems

content.raw:
Here are some of the questions I have while working on ign-sensors integration. Maybe that’s what moving the sensor manager to ign-gazebo is trying to address?

* How do we pass physics data to ign-sensors so we can generate sensor data? Maybe through ign-transport, ign-gazebo components, or something else? The problem with getting data through ign-transport is that it makes synchronization harder. 
* Do we need to pass sensor output and sensor states as components to other systems in ign-gazebo? Currently we just publish sensor data over ign-transport.

Regardless of where the sensor manager lives, there would be inconsistencies between using a rendering based sensor and a physics based sensor, e.g.

* camera sensor - create sensor and call update 
* imu sensor - create sensor, pass physics data and call update 

Not sure if we can get around with this limitation. Moving the sensor manager to ign-gazebo let users of ign-sensors know that it’s not a complete library / one stop shop for sensor simulation. Maybe that’s what we want for now.
content.html:
Here are some of the questions I have while working on ign-sensors integration. Maybe that’s what moving the sensor manager to ign-gazebo is trying to address?

  • How do we pass physics data to ign-sensors so we can generate sensor data? Maybe through ign-transport, ign-gazebo components, or something else? The problem with getting data through ign-transport is that it makes synchronization harder.
  • Do we need to pass sensor output and sensor states as components to other systems in ign-gazebo? Currently we just publish sensor data over ign-transport.

Regardless of where the sensor manager lives, there would be inconsistencies between using a rendering based sensor and a physics based sensor, e.g.

  • camera sensor - create sensor and call update
  • imu sensor - create sensor, pass physics data and call update

Not sure if we can get around with this limitation. Moving the sensor manager to ign-gazebo let users of ign-sensors know that it’s not a complete library / one stop shop for sensor simulation. Maybe that’s what we want for now.

content.raw:
This is something @iche033 and I have talked about before. I think there are 3 main tasks to be done: creating the sensor, updating its readings and updating its properties. Here are some ways in which I think it could be distributed, taking the camera as an example:

## 1

This is basically what we currently have, with `ign-sensors` managing sensors and `ign-gazebo` just calling it in the appropriate times: 

* **Creation**: `ign-gazebo` passes an SDF object to `ign-sensors`, which creates a `rendering::Camera` object internal to it and a `sensors::CameraSensor` which is kept with `ign-gazebo`. It also needs to keep the sensor manager.
* **Udate readings**: `ign-gazebo` updates the rendering scene and runs the `ign-sensor`'s manager at every update.
* **Update properties**: `ign-gazebo` calls `ign-sensors` APIs whenever it detects component updates, such as camera FOV changes.

The advantage is that `ign-sensors` exists as its own library which could be reused by others.
 
## 2

This would be an alternative completely without `ign-sensors`:

* **Creation**: `ign-gazebo` parses components and makes direct rendering calls to create a `rendering::Camera`
* **Udate readings**: `ign-gazebo` directly updates the scene and camera at every update
* **Update properties**: `ign-gazebo` calls `ign-rendering` APIs whenever it detects component updates, such as camera FOV changes.

The advantage is less complexity?

## 3

Something in between? It would be interesting to elaborate on what `Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models` would entail - would it just be wrappers around rendering and physics types, without lifecycle management?
content.html:
This is something @iche033 and I have talked about before. I think there are 3 main tasks to be done: creating the sensor, updating its readings and updating its properties. Here are some ways in which I think it could be distributed, taking the camera as an example:

1

This is basically what we currently have, with ign-sensors managing sensors and ign-gazebo just calling it in the appropriate times:

  • Creation: ign-gazebo passes an SDF object to ign-sensors, which creates a rendering::Camera object internal to it and a sensors::CameraSensor which is kept with ign-gazebo. It also needs to keep the sensor manager.
  • Udate readings: ign-gazebo updates the rendering scene and runs the ign-sensor's manager at every update.
  • Update properties: ign-gazebo calls ign-sensors APIs whenever it detects component updates, such as camera FOV changes.

The advantage is that ign-sensors exists as its own library which could be reused by others.

2

This would be an alternative completely without ign-sensors:

  • Creation: ign-gazebo parses components and makes direct rendering calls to create a rendering::Camera
  • Udate readings: ign-gazebo directly updates the scene and camera at every update
  • Update properties: ign-gazebo calls ign-rendering APIs whenever it detects component updates, such as camera FOV changes.

The advantage is less complexity?

3

Something in between? It would be interesting to elaborate on what Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models would entail - would it just be wrappers around rendering and physics types, without lifecycle management?

content.raw: I've been thinking a bit a bout the architecture of sensors and gazebo. Something that could work is moving the management of sensors from ign-senors to ign-gazebo. Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models. Management of the sensors would be left up to the user of ign-sensors. This idea is lacking details, but what do you all think of this approach? Are there obvious pitfalls?
content.html: I've been thinking a bit a bout the architecture of sensors and gazebo. Something that could work is moving the management of sensors from ign-senors to ign-gazebo. Ign-sensors would become a repository of sensor models. Management of the sensors would be left up to the user of ign-sensors. This idea is lacking details, but what do you all think of this approach? Are there obvious pitfalls?

update.description:
Inspired by the work started [here](https://bitbucket.org/JChoclin/ign-gazebo/branch/ign_sensors_integration#chg-src/SimulationRunner.cc) by @JChoclin.

Needs [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/488/port-pull-request-481-to-gz11/diff).

I'm not convinced of the current architecture yet, as I'm not sure exactly how Ignition Sensors is meant to be used. We may want to split it into multiple systems... one per sensor, one per group of sensors? 

---

## Try it out!

Run the example world:

    ign-gazebo -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/camera_sensor.sdf

Echo images to see they're indeed  being published:

    ign topic -e -t /camera

---

## TODO

* Decide on the architecture
* Populate scene from components
* Add ign-sensors as a dependency on CI
* Add tests
* Port ign-gui's image viewer to QtQuick so we can see the camera images
* Try multiple cameras
* ... anything else?
update.title: [WIP] Camera sensors

Run the example world:

    ign-gazebo -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/camera_sensor.sdf

Echo images to see they're indeed  being published:

    ign topic -e -t /camera

---

## TODO

* Decide on the architecture
* Populate scene from components
* Add ign-sensors as a dependency on CI
* Add tests
* Port ign-gui's image viewer to QtQuick so we can see the camera images
* Try multiple cameras
* ... anything else?
update.title: [WIP] Camera sensors

update.description:
Inspired by the work started [here](https://bitbucket.org/JChoclin/ign-gazebo/branch/ign_sensors_integration#chg-src/SimulationRunner.cc) by @JChoclin.

Needs [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/488/port-pull-request-481-to-gz11/diff).

I'm not convinced of the current architecture yet, as I'm not sure exactly how Ignition Sensors is meant to be used. We may want to split it into multiple systems... one per sensor, one per group of sensors? 

---

## Try it out!

Run the example world:

    ign-gazebo -v 4 -f ../examples/worlds/camera_sensor.sdf

Echo images to see they're indeed  being published:

    ign topic -e -t /camera

---

## TODO

* Decide on the architecture
* Populate scene from components
* Add ign-sensors as a dependency on CI
* Add tests
* Port ign-gui's image viewer to QtQuick so we can see the camera images
* Try multiple cameras
* ... anything else?
